result.execSummary:
The defendant Don Cornelius Oden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable mandatory costs, surcharges and assessments.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) in prison case 10CF2829.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing to be paid by 1/1/2019 or subject to civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other time being served.  Huber privileges for employment, Day Reporting Center for work search, treatment, programming, vocational training and education.  Good time allowed. Electronic monitoring prohibited.

DNA surcharge incorrect.

Filed by defense:
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
- Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
AMENDED INFORMATION FILED.

Defendant Don Cornelius Oden in court with attorney Jacob Manian.  Defendant Don Cornelius Oden in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury Trial.    Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Amended Information submitted by the state.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Court ordered charge AMENDED to MISDEMEANOR BATTERY, REPEATER, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 939.62(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
 
Statements made as to sentencing by Kayisis C., the state, defense, and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other time being served, with credit for 0 DAYS time served and Huber privileges for employment, day reporting center for work search, treatment, programming, vocational training, and education.  Good time allowed.  Electronic Monitoring prohibited.  The Court indicates that it is aware that this sentence might be served in Wisconsin state prison system due to the defendant being incarcerated in the prison system at this time.  

The state in compliance with victim rights legislation.  The Court orders NO CONTACT with Kayisis C.  The Court sets restitution set at zero.  The Court ordered the defendant to pay all applicable mandatory costs, surcharges, and assessments.  The Court ordered that said financial obligations be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) (in prison on case #10CF2829).  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing to be paid by 1-01-2019 or subject to civil judgment.  Appeal rights given.

Attorney Jacob Manian in court, defendant Don Cornelius Oden not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Final pre-trial held between counsel.  Defense still in a contest posture; parties prepared to proceed to trial.  Case remains set for Jury trial on 10-22-14 at 9:00 a.m. before Branch 21.
Filed.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of Preliminary Hearing commencing April 1, 2014 received and filed. (16 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Jacob Manian.

Attorney Jacob Manian in court, defendant Don Cornelius Oden not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense in a contest posture.  Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions must be heard prior to trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jacob Manian in court, defendant Don Cornelius Oden not in court, in custody.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense awaiting discovery materials from the state.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
At the request of defense (no objection by the state) the court grants adjournment.  Scheduling conference set for 6-02-14 RECALENDARED to 6-04-14 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.

Defendant Don Cornelius Oden in court with attorney Jacob Manian.  Defendant Don Cornelius Oden in custody.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Arraignment held.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Don Cornelius Oden in court with attorney Jacob Manian.  Defendant Don Cornelius Oden in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Hector Sosa-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Arraignment scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-01-2014 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kayisis C.   AND/OR   Donald L.   AND/OR  their residences   AND/OR  their places of employment

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice 2000 for supervision with the Pretrial Electronic Monitoring Program.  Absolutely no release from home.

No firearms/dangerous weapons

Defendant Don Cornelius Oden in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Don Cornelius Oden in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
As to Count 1:  Defendant entered a plea of Not Guilty.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
